oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mortar team at Vung Chua Mountain sighting an 81mm mortar
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Five soldiers appear in various stages of involvement in the task of sighting an 81 mm mortar. The walls are constructed of ammunition boxes that have been nailed together and filled with dirt.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mortars (Ordnance); Artillery (Weaponry); Military personnel; Soldiers; Military uniforms; Arms & armament
Mortars (Ordnance); Ammunition containers; United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam; Qui Nhon (Vietnam); Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The mortar team was charged with defending the perimeter around the signal station on Vung Cha Mountain; protecting the base's equipment, such as VHF, UHF, and microwave capabilities supporting patrols;; and maintaining an alert posture around the mountain.
